topics.body:
Feels like a curse when I can write a whole lot better when there's an audience or under pressure.

That would mean that every time I want to write, I'll end up stressed if I wrote good due to pressure or end up stress anyway because I can't write when I'm calm.

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552251106368727c1d9d2700#post_552251106368727c1d9d2700
Must've been the infamous doorbell ghost.
It is said to wander around aimlessly a few days after easter, putting chocolate bunnies wrapped in tinfoil and condoms filled with ectoplasm in people's mailboxes then furiously ringing the doorbell of people, even if they don't have one. It will just pull out a doorbell from under it's sleves if it doesn't find any after five minutes of searching. It is also said to dig holes in the backyard looking for potentially hidden doorbells from people who might've hidden them there. Mostly though, the ghost just throws empty bottles of whiskey in the holes and take a piss all over them. The ghost is named Fred and is extremely afraid of cats, especially black cats since he was a racist doorbell salesman and part time chimneysweeper in his past life.
